    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Turtle(DrawingArea canvas)
      Creates a Turtle in the center of the specified DrawingCanvas, facing right.

      Tells this turtle which color pen to use.
      private static double computeDeltaX(double distance, double degrees)
      Computes how much to move to add to this Turtle's x-coordinate, in order to displace the Turtle by (approximately) distance pixels in direction degrees.
      private static double computeDeltaY(double distance, double degrees)
      Computes how much to move to add to this Turtle's y-coordinate, in order to displace the Turtle by (approximately) distance pixels in direction degrees.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle(DrawingArea canvas)
        Creates a Turtle in the center of the specified DrawingCanvas, facing right.
        Parameters:
        canvas - The DrawingCanvas for this turtle.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Make sure this turtle (and its associated canvas) is in a known initial state.

      • forward

        public void forward(double distance)
        Moves this Turtle forward the specified distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - The approximate number of pixels to move.

      • right

        public void right(double angle)
        Turns this Turtle to the right by the specified angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The number of degrees to turn to the right.

      • left

        public void left(double angle)
        Turns this Turtle to the left by the specified angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The number of degrees to turn to the left.

      • bringIntoRange

        static double bringIntoRange(double oldDegrees)
        Given a number of degrees, adjust the number to be in the range 0 to 360.
        Parameters:
        oldDegrees - Some number of degrees.
        Returns:
        An equivalent number of degrees.

      • home

        public void home()
        Moves this Turtle to the center of the drawing area, facing right.

      • jump

        public void jump(double x,
        double y)
        Moves this Turtle to a specified (x, y) location.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate

      • penup

        public void penup()
        Tells this turtle to raise the pen.

      • pendown

        public void pendown()
        Tells this turtle to lower the pen.

      • color

        public void color(java.lang.String colorName)
        Tells this turtle which color pen to use.
        Parameters:
        colorName - The name of the color to use.

      • color

        public void color(int colorNum1,
         int colorNum2,
         int colorNum3)
        Tells this turtle which color pen to use.
        Parameters:
        colorNum1 - The first RGB component of the color to use.
        colorNum2 - The second RGB component of the color to use.
        colorNum3 - The third RGB component of the color to use.

      • stringAt

        public void stringAt(java.lang.String message,
            int newX,
            int newY)
        This is a garbage method, intended as another example of writing a Turtle method. TODO: Delete this method
        Parameters:
        message - A string to display.
        newX - Where to display the string.
        newY - Where to display the string.

      • setDegrees

        public void setDegrees(double degrees)
        Sets the degrees of direction the frog is facing. (0=right, 90=up, 180=left, 270=down)
        Parameters:
        degrees - of direction to set to

      • getX

        public double getX()
        Gets the x location of the frog.
        Returns:
        x location

      • getY

        public double getY()
        Gets the y location of the frog.
        Returns:
        y location

      • setPaused

        public void setPaused(boolean paused)
        If the parameter is true, causes the turtle to stop whatever it is doing and wait for another call of this method with the parameter false.
        Parameters:
        paused - Whether the turtle should be paused.

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int oldSpeed)
        Sets the turtle speed.
        Parameters:
        oldSpeed - A value from 0 (stopped) to 100 (full speed).

      • computeDeltaX

        private static double computeDeltaX(double distance,
                   double degrees)
        Computes how much to move to add to this Turtle's x-coordinate, in order to displace the Turtle by (approximately) distance pixels in direction degrees.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance to move.
        degrees - The direction in which to move.
        Returns:
        The amount to be added to the x-coordinate.

      • computeDeltaY

        private static double computeDeltaY(double distance,
                   double degrees)
        Computes how much to move to add to this Turtle's y-coordinate, in order to displace the Turtle by (approximately) distance pixels in direction degrees.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance to move.
        degrees - The direction in which to move.
        Returns:
        The amount to be added to the y-coordinate.

      • finish

        private void finish()
        Updates the drawing area. This method should be called at the conclusion of every Turtle command.

      • tellCanvasWhereIAm

        private void tellCanvasWhereIAm()
        Computes the coordinates of the points of a triangle to represent the current position and direction of this Turtle. The triangle points are sent to the DrawingCanvas but do not go into the DrawingCanvas's list of commands.
